trans-unit.source: Monitor a DocumentDB account by using the Azure preview portal | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Monitor a DocumentDB account by using the Azure preview portal | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to monitor your DocumentDB account for performance metrics, such as requests and server errors, and usage metrics, such as storage consumption.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to monitor your DocumentDB account for performance metrics, such as requests and server errors, and usage metrics, such as storage consumption.

trans-unit.source: You can monitor your DocumentDB accounts in the <linkText>Microsoft Azure preview portal</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: You can monitor your DocumentDB accounts in the <linkText>Microsoft Azure preview portal</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: For each DocumentDB account, both performance metrics, such as requests and server errors, and usage metrics, such as storage consumption, are available.
trans-unit.target: For each DocumentDB account, both performance metrics, such as requests and server errors, and usage metrics, such as storage consumption, are available.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure preview portal, click Browse All, DocumentDB Accounts, and then click the name of the DocumentDB account for which you would like to view performance metrics.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure preview portal, click Browse All, DocumentDB Accounts, and then click the name of the DocumentDB account for which you would like to view performance metrics.

trans-unit.source: Within the Monitoring lens you can, by default, see:
trans-unit.target: Within the Monitoring lens you can, by default, see:

trans-unit.source: Total requests for the current day.
trans-unit.target: Total requests for the current day.

trans-unit.source: Average requests per second for the current day.
trans-unit.target: Average requests per second for the current day.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Screen shot of the Monitoring lens</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Screen shot of the Monitoring lens</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Clicking on the Total Requests or Average Requests per Second part opens a detailed Metric blade.
trans-unit.target: Clicking on the Total Requests or Average Requests per Second part opens a detailed Metric blade.

trans-unit.source: The Metric blade shows you details about the metrics you have selected.
trans-unit.target: The Metric blade shows you details about the metrics you have selected.

trans-unit.source: At the top of the blade is a graph and below that a table which shows aggregation values of the selected metrics such as average, minimum, and maximum.
trans-unit.target: At the top of the blade is a graph and below that a table which shows aggregation values of the selected metrics such as average, minimum, and maximum.

trans-unit.source: The metric blade also shows the list of alerts which have been defined, filtered to the metrics that appear on the current metric blade (this way, if you have a number of alerts, you'll only see the relevant ones presented here).
trans-unit.target: The metric blade also shows the list of alerts which have been defined, filtered to the metrics that appear on the current metric blade (this way, if you have a number of alerts, you'll only see the relevant ones presented here).

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Screenshot of the Metric blade</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Screenshot of the Metric blade</linkText>

trans-unit.source: To customize the metrics that display in a particular part, right-click the metric chart, and then select Edit Chart.
trans-unit.target: To customize the metrics that display in a particular part, right-click the metric chart, and then select Edit Chart.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Screen shot of the Total Requests chart with the Edit Chart button highlighted</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Screen shot of the Total Requests chart with the Edit Chart button highlighted</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Edit Chart blade, there are options to modify the metrics that display in the part, as well as their time range.
trans-unit.target: On the Edit Chart blade, there are options to modify the metrics that display in the part, as well as their time range.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Screen shot of the Edit Chart blade</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Screen shot of the Edit Chart blade</linkText>

trans-unit.source: To change the metrics displayed in the part, simply select or clear the available performance metrics, and then click Save at the bottom of the blade.
trans-unit.target: To change the metrics displayed in the part, simply select or clear the available performance metrics, and then click Save at the bottom of the blade.

trans-unit.source: To change the time range, choose a different range (for example, Custom), and then click Save at the bottom of the blade.
trans-unit.target: To change the time range, choose a different range (for example, Custom), and then click Save at the bottom of the blade.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Screen shot of the Time Range part of the Edit Chart blade showing how to enter a custom time range</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Screen shot of the Time Range part of the Edit Chart blade showing how to enter a custom time range</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The Azure preview portal allows you to create side-by-side metric charts.
trans-unit.target: The Azure preview portal allows you to create side-by-side metric charts.

trans-unit.source: First, right-click on the chart you want to clone and modify and select Customize.
trans-unit.target: First, right-click on the chart you want to clone and modify and select Customize.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Screen shot of the Total Requests chart with the Customize option highlighted</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Screen shot of the Total Requests chart with the Customize option highlighted</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Clone on the menu to copy the part and then click Done customizing.
trans-unit.target: Click Clone on the menu to copy the part and then click Done customizing.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Screen shot of the Total Requests chart with the Clone and Done customizing options highlighted</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Screen shot of the Total Requests chart with the Clone and Done customizing options highlighted</linkText>

trans-unit.source: You may now treat this part as any other metric part, customizing the metrics and time range displayed in the part.
trans-unit.target: You may now treat this part as any other metric part, customizing the metrics and time range displayed in the part.

trans-unit.source: By doing this, you can see two different metrics chart side-by-side at the same time.
trans-unit.target: By doing this, you can see two different metrics chart side-by-side at the same time.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Screen shot of the Total Requests chart and the new Total Requests past hour chart</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Screen shot of the Total Requests chart and the new Total Requests past hour chart</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the Azure preview portal, click Browse, DocumentDB Accounts, and then click the name of the DocumentDB account for which you would like to see usage metrics.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure preview portal, click Browse, DocumentDB Accounts, and then click the name of the DocumentDB account for which you would like to see usage metrics.

trans-unit.source: Within the Usage lens you can view the following by default:
trans-unit.target: Within the Usage lens you can view the following by default:

trans-unit.source: Estimated cost to date of the DocumentDB account for the current billing period.
trans-unit.target: Estimated cost to date of the DocumentDB account for the current billing period.

trans-unit.source: Storage consumed within the account.
trans-unit.target: Storage consumed within the account.

trans-unit.source: Maximum available storage of the account (threshold).
trans-unit.target: Maximum available storage of the account (threshold).

trans-unit.source: User and permission usage.
trans-unit.target: User and permission usage.

trans-unit.source: Attachment usage.
trans-unit.target: Attachment usage.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Screen shot of the Usage lens</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Screen shot of the Usage lens</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the Azure preview portal, click Browse All, DocumentDB Accounts, and then click the name of the DocumentDB account for which you would like to setup performance metric alerts.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure preview portal, click Browse All, DocumentDB Accounts, and then click the name of the DocumentDB account for which you would like to setup performance metric alerts.

trans-unit.source: Within the Operations lens, click the Alert rules part.
trans-unit.target: Within the Operations lens, click the Alert rules part.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Screen shot of the Operations lens, with the Alert rules part selected</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Screen shot of the Operations lens, with the Alert rules part selected</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the Alert rules blade, click Add alert.
trans-unit.target: In the Alert rules blade, click Add alert.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Screenshot of the Alert Rules blade, with the Add Alert button highlighted</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Screenshot of the Alert Rules blade, with the Add Alert button highlighted</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the Add an alert rule blade, specify:
trans-unit.target: In the Add an alert rule blade, specify:

trans-unit.source: The name of the alert rule you are setting up.
trans-unit.target: The name of the alert rule you are setting up.

trans-unit.source: A description of the new alert rule.
trans-unit.target: A description of the new alert rule.

trans-unit.source: The metric for the alert rule.
trans-unit.target: The metric for the alert rule.

trans-unit.source: The condition, threshold, and period that determine when the alert activates.
trans-unit.target: The condition, threshold, and period that determine when the alert activates.

trans-unit.source: For example, a server error count greater than 5 over the last 15 minutes.
trans-unit.target: For example, a server error count greater than 5 over the last 15 minutes.

trans-unit.source: Whether the service administrator and coadministrators are emailed when the alert fires.
trans-unit.target: Whether the service administrator and coadministrators are emailed when the alert fires.

trans-unit.source: Additional email addresses for alert notifications.
trans-unit.target: Additional email addresses for alert notifications.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Screen shot of the Add an alert rule blade</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Screen shot of the Add an alert rule blade</linkText>

trans-unit.source: To learn more about DocumentDB capacity, see <linkText>Manage DocumentDB capacity</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: To learn more about DocumentDB capacity, see <linkText>Manage DocumentDB capacity</linkText><title></title>.
